parameters.name: ReverseDir
parameters.description: True reverses the angle direction, false does not

parameters.name: RevType
parameters.description: Type of revolution as defined in swRevolveType_e (can be either mid-plane or two-direction)

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

title: IFeatureManager.FeatureRevolveCut
signature:
Feature FeatureRevolveCut( 
   System.Double
Angle
,
   System.Boolean
ReverseDir
,
   System.Double
Angle2
,
   System.Int32
RevType
,
   System.Int32
Options
,
   System.Boolean
UseFeatScope
,
   System.Boolean
UseAutoSelect
)

parameters.name: ReverseDir
parameters.description: True reverses the angle direction, false does not

parameters.name: RevType
parameters.description: Type of revolution as defined in swRevolveType_e (can be either mid-plane or two-direction)

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

remarks:
The Options argument allows additional control of the feature creation. Supported value is
swAutoCloseSketch
close the sketch if it is open.
When UseAutoSelect is false, the user must select the bodies that the feature will affect.
When using cut or cavity features that result in multiple bodies, you cannot select to keep all of the resulting bodies or one or more selected bodies.
For extruded feature cuts, see
IFeatureManager::FeatureCut
.
